in_reply_to.text: @JNRowe@eads_cs Time to posse that, or you'll stuffed when you leave.

text: @blaze@eads_cs Thanks for the nudge, couple of minutes in to a solution now.
Just finished my 1º #guile #make extension… TIL none of our CI servers have #make with #guile support, and many devs have pre-GPL3 make.
Got myself on the #aoc leaderboard this morning(#91)… now back to sleep as its 5am 😪  http://adventofcode.com/2017/leaderboard/day/9
TFW you realise it will be quicker to fix build failures for old emacs version than update your old configuration for new emacs version
TIL you can use #typescript to make #gnome shell extensions.  Far, far nicer experience AFAIC.
Proof you work with strange nerds #0: Your *favourite* co-worker has added ‚Äú<nav class='reclamantes'>‚Äù to your project’s documentation
Love python f-strings… however, I just saw a lambda defined *in* one.  Like finding a piece of mouse tail in your fourth pakora
Things I never thought I’d say: “Wonder if someone has reverse engineered Shimano’s new gear config system yet?”  (Not on GitHub FWIW)
Dropped my #zsh startup from 1.2s to 0.4s by just thinking about it.  Well, that and noticing I was burning nearly a second on a spinlock
… and 0.13s by fixing my ``~/build.ninja`` to prefer ``zcompile``'ing whole directories instead of individual files

media.comment: Screenshot from Missions bug fixing session

text: Travelling to Mars seems cool, right?  Maybe not; have to fix go code, and people won’t use ``:syntax on``.  #Missions has been fun though
So was Microsoft Surface a really clever Bait & Switch?  A search reveals people gushing over the table, and links to buy the table*t*
Stranger on train: “Mind if a eat this sandwich?” Me: “‘course not… assuming it isn’t tuna.” Other random passenger: “Sadly, people who eat tuna or egg don’t ask”
OH: You use the word “logic” in a way which, er… proves you don’t know what it means and is simultaneously utterly devoid of it
Work friend: ”It is nice that you’re learning Russian, not so much that I need to merge to мастер”
Just finished watching The Handmaid’s Tale season 2; ☆☆☆☆☆. I… words have failed me

references.title: Modern Vim - Craft Your Development Environment with Vim 8 and Neovim

text: Reading “Modern Vim”.  Absolutely fantastic, loads of ‘TIL’ moments even after literally decades of vim use.
Eddy looks *disturbingly* poised for action too.  All in all, excellent tip jar gift.  Thanks @mickey@eads_cs!

in_reply_to.text: I think "This Is America"-type shows have lost their edge, in part because populists are behaving equally ridiculous on News 24

text: @rafe@eads_cs So, at some point I’m going to realise you’re a character in *my* Truman Show and you’re helping me find the exit?
Thought: If #vim performed a ``<C-g>u`` equivalent on typing ``[\.!?¿:;]``, the undo tree when writing prose would be vastly improved.  Let’s see…
The instant gratification with pygal is huge.  Truly beautiful output in a matter of minutes from popping open the docs.  Just. Use. It.
@MissLB@eads_cs Posted “Vim with day/night colourschemes” especially for you, not promising I’ll bring back the frequent tips though

in_reply_to.text: @JNRowe@eads_cs Wow, *that* is what I'm talking about.  Make. Tips. Great. Again.

text: @MissLB@eads_cs Really enjoyed churning it out actually; more so now I’ve seen Mickey’s golf.  I’m at L440 on Tuesday, I’ll drop in for coffee prize!
Prepping my talk for Space Saturday(yep, this Saturday).  Realise I‚Äôm largely trying to decide whether to make bear jokes or political commentary.
Oh, and I have guest tickets for the 11‚Äôup event if ‚Äî like me ‚Äî you want to visit the yard and haven‚Äôt been allowed in before.  @ or mail me.
Friend tells story of co-worker who explains /everything/ in story form using ST:TNG‚Äôs *amazing* Darmok episode as a device‚Ä¶ without ever seeing the loop. ü§Ø
Playing around with GitHub issue replies for @Nathan@eads_cs
So, how do folks go about finding a good recruitment consultant?  First time in fifteen years, and it looks full lemon.

in_reply_to.text: @JNRowe@eads_cs Text is good, but what does the tiling layout *look* like? Give a talk at hackday for us newbs?

text: @Kat@eads_cs Added an image, HTH.  I‚Äôve been thinking about an #awesomewm talk for a little while now, so maybe‚Ä¶
GNU‚Äôs take on a CoC-alike is really quite interesting, and looks useful in general.  Perhaps we should replace ours by a link?
So‚Ä¶ there is a use for tabs in #vim.  Mimic zoom in/out without plugin hackery.  ``tabedit %`` in, then ``<C-w>c`` out.
And I guess bonus points for using ``set stal=0``.  Probably easy to get lost though.
@dev_b@eads_cs Remembering it is Diwali is *not* the same when Milly isn‚Äôt around to send me laddu.  Hope you‚Äôre enjoying it nonetheless.
Timeline is full of people recommending ‚ÄúLittle Drummer Girl‚Äù; iPlayer catchup of 1º ep reveals it is ‚ÄúTeam America‚Äù as a period drama
‚Ä¶ wherein the Charlie character(Florence Pugh) is great, and the others would be improved as puppets.

in_reply_to.text: People, how do you store chromium configs in home VC?  It is just a horrific mess of JSON dumps with awful whitespace and sorting.

text: @chewy@eads_cs ÿ≥ŸÑÿßŸÖ, Becky.  ``sqlite3 .dump`` and ``js -S .`` are your friends; use tools to recreate *valuable* hunks, and ignore rest.

references.title: Can not install any poetry based project with pip from source distribution

text: If you‚Äôre thinking about using Python‚Äôs poetry mod[hi, Paul!], be aware it breaks *all* reproducible builds and creates a packaging nightmare.
